Identifying Characteristics: Reddish-brown or blackish color of its foot and slow moving nature
Shell has four whorls going in a counter clockwise motion
Biology: Become reproductively mature at about 3-4 months
Lay eggs in a gelatinous mass attached to rocks or plants
Lifespan of about a year or less
Habitat: Lakes and ponds and quiet portions of streams
Substrates (rock soils, gravel, and on almost on any freshwater bottom)
Range: Canada (Alberta, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland I, Nova Scotia, Ontario, Prince Edward I., Québec, Saskatchewan)
United States (Connecticut, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Maine, Massachusetts, Michigan, Minnesota, New York, North Dakota, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Vermont, Wisconsin)
